title: Taiwan fires warning shots at unidentified drone near islands
description: Taiwanese soldiers on Tuesday fired flares at three unidentified drones that flew near Kinmen County, an offshore grouping of islands, before firing warning shots at one drone which re-entered the area above one of the islands, according to the Kinmen Defense Command.

title: NASA releases stunning new image of the Phantom Galaxy
description: Stunning new images produced by the Hubble Telescope and the James Webb Telescope showcase the Phantom Galaxy, a spiral of solar systems 32 million light-years away from Earth.

title: US Navy prevents Iranian attempt to capture American maritime drone in Persian Gulf
description: The US Navy prevented an Iranian ship from capturing an American maritime drone in the Arabian gulf overnight Monday into Tuesday local time in what a senior US commander called a "flagrant" and "unwarranted" incident.

title: That comforting cup of tea could help lower your risk of death, study finds
description: A warm cup of tea in your favorite mug can seem to heal the soul -- and a new study finds it may be good for your body, too.

title: 'Darkest place I've ever been in': NBA star describes suicidal thoughts over past 2 years
description: Five-time NBA All-Star John Wall described his struggle with suicidal thoughts and mental health challenges over the last two years in an interview earlier this month.

title: Many people feared trapped under multiple-story building collapse in Nigeria
description: A multiple-story building has collapsed in the northwestern Nigerian city of Kano, leaving "many" people  feared trapped inside, according to the local fire service.

title: Tomato-covered California highway causes chaos
description: Thousands of tomatoes were left covering the highway after a tomato truck crashed on California's Interstate 80 on Monday, leaving three people injured, according to officials.

title: CNN report explains cause of violent protests in Iraq
description: CNN Senior International Correspondent Ben Wedeman reports on the civil unrest in Iraq following controversial cleric Muqtada al-Sadr's decision to leave political life.

title: How these floating homes might withstand hurricane conditions
description: CNN's Alison Kosik speaks with Ocean Builders CEO Grant Romundt about the floating homes his company is building off the coast of Panama and what the future of ocean living might look like.

title: 'Please keep praying for me as I continue to get better': Injured Little Leaguer speaks publicly after transfer home
description: The Instagram account set-up to provide updates on injured Little Leaguer Easton Oliverson posted a video of the 12-year-old on Tuesday speaking publicly for the first time since incurring a head injury.

title: Kohl's and Gap have a surprising plan for this season's unsold clothing
description: Retailers are overstocked on clothing, and some are packing it away in hopes of selling it in future seasons.

title: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex and Mariah Carey talk biracial identity in new podcast
description: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex returned with the second episode of her "Archetypes" podcast this week, this time featuring a conversation with Mariah Carey.

title: Thousands of tomatoes spill onto highway after crash
description: Loads of tomatoes spilled from a big rig after a crash on I-80 near Vacaville, California, on Monday morning, according to California Highway Patrol.

title: Bodies at bottom of medieval well show 'real horror' of antisemitic violence
description: Construction workers breaking ground in 2004 on a shopping mall in Norwich, England, found 17 bodies at the bottom of a 800-year-old well.

title: TV anchor says she got fired for letting her hair go gray. See CNN anchor's reaction
description: CNN anchors Erica Hill and Christine Romans and CNN business correspondent Rahel Solomon share their thoughts about the firing of Canadian TV news anchor Lisa LaFlamme after she claimed she was ousted because she let her hair go gray.

title: Officers seize a shipment of baby wipes that turned out to be $11.8 million worth of cocaine
description: A shipment of baby wipes at the US-Mexico border turned out to be something quite different: $11.8 million worth of cocaine.

title: Ukraine claims early success in counteroffensive as Zelensky vows to 'chase' Russians to the border
description: As Ukraine ramps up its offensive to retake Russian-occupied territory in the country's south, its forces have regained four villages and broken through Russian defenses at multiple points of the frontline in the Kherson region, according to Ukrainian officials.

title: J.K. Rowling says it was her choice not to appear in 'Harry Potter' reunion
description: J.K. Rowling says she was invited to participate in the "Harry Potter 20th Anniversary: Return to Hogwarts" reunion special earlier this year but declined.

title: Pandemic-era splurging on pets could be over
description: Worries about the economy have suddenly put shares of pet supply retailers in Wall Street's doghouse.

title: Penguin fitted with special orthopedic shoe can waddle in style
description: Lucas the penguin now has a case of happy feet.

title: Open Championship winner Cameron Smith, five other players join LIV Golf
description: The Saudi-backed LIV Golf series announced Tuesday that Open Championship winner and world No. 2 Cameron Smith has joined the rebel professional golf tour along with five other players.

title: CNN meteorologist explains cause of water crisis in Jackson, Mississippi
description: CNN meteorologist Chad Myers explains how flooding in Jackson, Mississippi caused the failure of the main water treatment facility, resulting in a clean water crisis in the state's largest city.

title: Elon Musk thinks the population will collapse. Is the global birth rate that bad?
description: Billionaire Elon Musk tweeted, not for the first time, that "population collapse due to low birth rates is a much bigger risk to civilization than global warming." Climate change is a serious problem facing the planet and experts say it's difficult to compare problems. What is clear, demographers say, is that the global population is growing, despite declines in some parts of the world, and it shouldn't be collapsing any time soon.

title: Eugenio Derbez injured in accident, according to wife
description: Actor Eugenio Derbez, known for his work in films like "CODA" and the remake of "Overboard," was injured an accident of an undisclosed nature and is facing a long recovery, according to his wife, Mexican actress and singer Alessandra Rosaldo.

title: Powerful Iraqi cleric tells supporters to stand down after day of deadly violence in Baghdad
description: Baghdad was left reeling on Tuesday from some of the deadliest violence seen in the Iraqi capital in years, after clashes sparked by a powerful cleric's withdrawal from politics plunged the country deeper into crisis.

title: Robert LuPone, 'The Sopranos' star and theater veteran, dies age 76
description: Robert "Bob" LuPone, the Tony and Emmy nominated actor arguably best known for his role in hit TV show "The Sopranos," has died at the age of 76.

title: Uber now lets users text with a safety agent to monitor rides
description: Uber is giving riders the ability to connect with a safety agent while taking a nerve-wracking trip, making it the latest feature the company has added in recent years to address safety concerns.

title: Floatplane pilot captures scary encounter with circling boat
description: Floatplane pilot Eric Lee was attempting to exit Alaska's Halibut Cove with seven passengers aboard when the aircraft was circled at close proximity by a boater. He describes the encounter to CNN affiliate KTUU. Both the US Coast Guard and Alaska State Troopers are investigating the incident, according to KTUU.

title: The pandemic was bad for Britain's iconic pubs. This could be worse
description: First it was the coronavirus pandemic that forced pubs to shut their doors and rely on government support to survive the collapse in business. Now, Britain's iconic watering holes say they are battling an even greater threat: soaring energy prices.

title: 'It's weird': Former Trump advisor reacts to Melania Trump's latest projects
description: While the former President Donald Trump has fumed about the FBI's search of Mar-a-Lago, former first lady Melania Trump has been quiet. CNN's Kate Bennett has new details of Mrs. Trump's reaction to the search.

title: Pakistan floods caused by 'monsoon on steroids,' says UN chief in urgent appeal
description: UN Secretary General António Guterres on Tuesday warned that the world is "sleepwalking" into environmental destruction, as he  launched a flash $160 million appeal for flood-ravaged Pakistan.

title: The volcano-inspired superyacht concept with a 'molten staircase'
description: From spaceships, to sharks, and even diamonds, inspiration can come from all kinds of places when it comes to creating new and innovative superyacht concepts.

title: Mukesh Ambani prepares to hand a $220 billion empire to his children
description: Indian billionaire Mukesh Ambani has laid out plans to hand his sprawling business empire to his children, while insisting he has no intention of retiring any time soon.

title: Dinosaur ribcage unearthed in 'gobsmacking' backyard discovery
description: Home renovations can unearth all sorts of unexpected items, but one Portuguese property owner discovered hidden treasure on another scale when he stumbled upon what could be Europe's largest dinosaur remains.

title: Antoine Griezmann scores as Atlético Madrid defeats Valencia
description: Atlético Madrid recorded a second win of the season with a hard-fought 1-0 victory against Valencia at the Mestalla.

title: Lion mauls man to death after he enters enclosure at Ghana zoo
description: A lion at Ghana's Accra Zoo mauled a man to death after he entered its enclosure over the weekend, the government said in a statement.

title: Serena Williams begins US Open with a convincing singles win
Solomon Islands to ban all foreign navy ships from ports pending new approval process
description: The Solomon Islands has suspended entry into its waters for foreign navy ships pending adoption of a new process for approval of port visits, the Prime Minister's office said on Tuesday, in a bid to better police its exclusive economic zones.

title: Chris Dawson found guilty of murdering wife Lynette, ending 40-year Australian mystery
description: One of Australia's longest-running cold cases documented in the popular "Teacher's Pet" podcast has ended with the conviction of Chris Dawson for the murder of his wife Lynette.

title: China shuts world's largest electronics market as Shenzhen imposes more lockdowns
description: China's southern city of Shenzhen on Monday shut down the world's largest electronics market and suspended public transport nearby as authorities enforced neighborhood-wide lockdowns in response to a small number of Covid cases.

title: Bianca Andreescu gives Nike a dressing down at US Open before issuing apology
description: Former US Open champion Bianca Andreescu apologized to her sponsor Nike for an on-court outburst after her choice of wardrobe for Monday's first-round match landed her in a spot of bother amid windy conditions.

title: Does the anti-Taliban resistance stand a chance?
description: In August 2021, all US soldiers left Afghanistan, enabling the Taliban to take over the country. Since then, the Taliban have installed a theocracy that bans women from most jobs and bars girls over the age of 12 from attending school, while maintaining close relationships with terrorist groups, such as al Qaeda.

title: China arrests hundreds in rural banking scandal
description: Police in China have arrested 234 suspects allegedly involved in a rural banking scandal, a month after hundreds of depositors protested over their lost savings in one of the largest demonstrations the country has seen since the pandemic began.

title: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani is now the world's third richest man
description: Gautam Adani was already Asia's richest man.
